Let your superintendent know you want comprehensive sexual education to be taught in your district.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

On May 31, Governor Polis signed HB19-1032 – the Youth Wellness Act – recognizing that ALL young people deserve real and comprehensive sexual education. This could not have happened without your support! Since then, the Colorado Department of Public Health and Education has been working tirelessly with community members to launch a grant application process for schools to apply for newly available state funding to implement comprehensive sexual education. The deadline for grant applications is Friday, November 1.

This morning, we launched our Real Sex Ed website at www.RealSexEdCO.org. On this site you will find answers to FAQs on the newly enacted law, educational resources, an advocacy toolkit for implementing Real Sex Ed in your school district, and an email hotline where you can submit questions or concerns about your local sexual education curriculum.

This week we will be sending a letter to each school district informing them of key changes to the law and the availability of state funding.

We need your help to ensure your school district is providing students with Real Sex Ed. Contact your superintendent today and encourage them to implement comprehensive sex ed in your district schools and apply for state grant funding by the Friday, November 1 deadline. Find your school district and superintendent information.

Together we passed the Youth Wellness Act, now let's make sure we hold our school districts accountable and get them the resources they need to implement it.

Reach out to your school district today and let them know you want comprehensive sexual education to be taught in your district.

ACLU of Colorado
